This field is used to store a subroutine that will get called if all the "restriction" and "holdings" test have passed.
The format of the subroutine is as follows:
SECURITY.NUMBER - Outgoing - The SECURITY.MASTER ID being traded. Example: 000001-000
PORTFOLIO.NO - Outgoing - The customers portfolio number. Example: 100113-1
TRANSACTION.DATE - Outgoing - The transaction date of the trade. Example: 20020214
TRANSACTION.CODE - Outgoing - The transaction code of the trade. Example: BUY
ACCOUNT.NO - Outgoing - The customers account number (maybe null). Example: 18901
AMOUNT - Outgoing - The value of the transaction being traded. Example: 10000
CCY - Outgoing - The currency of the AMOUNT being traded. Example: GBP
RESTRICTION - Returned - 1: Subroutine test successful, anything else: Subroutine failure
Subroutine must exist in the PGM.FILE.
Specifies the key of the AM.ENTITY record. This field identifies the attributes on which generic holding checks would be performed.
Multi-valued field associated with all the fields from NATIONALITY to RESTRICTION.
Specifies the Validity Date of the constraint.

If the restriction on being the beneficial owner only lasts until a particular date then the final date upon which the restriction applies should be entered in the VALIDITY.DATE field associated with the Nationality or Residence to which this limited restriction applies.
If the VALIDITY.DATE field associated with a Nationality is unlimited then the VALIDITY.DATE field should be left blank.
It is possible to input a VALIDITY.DATE in the past.
Up to 9 type D date characters, (Standard Date format in range 1950-2049).
Field associated with the fields APP.APPLI, APP.FIELD and APP.VALUE at a sub-value level and NATIONALITY and RESTRICTION on a multi-valued level.
Optional field containing 'EQ', 'NE', 'LE', 'LT', 'GE' or 'GT' or 'RG'.
If any input is made into the associated APP.APPLI then this field must be populated.
This field together with the fields APP.APPLI, APP.FIELD and APP.VALUE are used to refine the selection of customers / securities / sec.acc.master to which restrictions apply.

If the specified field on the associated application contains multiple values then each value will be tested; where the APP.OPERAND is 'NE' these checks are assumed to be linked with 'AND', i.e. none of them must give a 'true' result. For all other APP.OPERAND values, multiple checks are assumed to be linked with 'OR', so a 'true' result for any of the checks will satisfy the criteria.
2 character field
Acceptable values are :- EQ - equal to, NE - not equal to, LT - less than, LE - less than or equal to, GT - greater than, GE - greater than or equal to, GT - greater than, RG - range of values
The operator to be applied where multiple holding considerarions are applied, either AND or OR.
